poem:
"An Impending Election Dance"

Clad in rhetoric's tinsel, 
leaders bob like apples.
New Hampshire dons a bitter chill,
as party feud bristles.
In the shadow of the ballot box,
no Biden to be seen. 
A dance floor set for '24,
with absences foreseen.
Trump and Haley prancing
to the voting tune,
while Democrats left shivering
under the granite moon.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Biden’s name won’t appear on New Hampshire ballots – where does that leave Democrats? While Donald Trump and Nikki Haley might draw focus, a shadow presidential primary is taking place in New Hampshire, where Joe Biden could stumble at the first hurdle of his bid to run for president again in 2024 following an internal Democratic party feud. As a consequence of the party scrap, Biden’s name will not even appear on the ballot in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
